definition: to be unable to find a solution/to be at wits' end
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
chip (in gambling)/token (for counting)/ticket/to prepare/to plan/to raise (funds)/resource/means
do not/there is none who
surname Mo
surname Zhan
to spread out/to open up/to exhibit/to put into effect/to postpone/to prolong/exhibition

sentences.english: Cement firms see no way to alter the basic chemistry of cement-making.
sentences.chinese: 水泥生產商對於改進水泥基本化學成分一籌莫展。

sentences.english: The mind boggles at the infinite universe.
sentences.chinese: 有才智的人面對廣闊無邊的宇宙也是一籌莫展。

sentences.english: See such things, gold well very angry, but helpless.
sentences.chinese: 看到這樣的事情，金井十分生氣，卻又一籌莫展。

sentences.english: Posthouse official and the owner of tavern are at a loss what to do.
sentences.chinese: 驛丞和客棧的老闆愁得一籌莫展。

definition: lit. the salted fish turns over (idiom)/fig. to experience a reversal of fortune
to prevail upon/to coax
(Tw) to buy off influential people (in an election, a call for tenders etc)
lit. fight with one's back to the river (idiom); fig. to fight to win or die
to dispatch/to assign/a dispatch
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
fight a battle of words/cross verbal swords
lit. to fix the tone with a single hammer blow/fig. to make the final decision
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
equestrianism/horsemanship
to run a newspaper/to publish a newspaper
to surmount all difficulties (on the way to success) (idiom)/abbr. for 過五關斬六將|过五关斩六将[guo4 wu3 guan1 zhan3 liu4 jiang4]
peer competition/to function as rivals/to make claims as an equal
variant of 勸誡|劝诫[quan4 jie4]
